title_review: Should be below 500 not top 4 in Madrid
review_preview: Having read all superb reviews on TA, we went for a dinner to this place. It is a small local bar with several tables to sit 25/30 guests, which felt like a cheap bar for passers-by who are very hungry and have a very little...
review_full: Having read all superb reviews on TA, we went for a dinner to this place. It is a small local bar with several tables to sit 25/30 guests, which felt like a cheap bar for passers-by who are very hungry and have a very little budget to spend on food. We ordered two starters, one of which was not fully cooked. When our main entrees arrived, plates from the starters weren't even taken away! As to the quality of food, in my opinion, I cook much better, because to call an entree a piece of pork with a slice of cheese melted over, is something I would never dare to do. Was this place absolutely horrible? Not, it was not, I am sure that the local staff did their best, within their limited capacities...But calling it number 4 in Madrid is insane, unless you never ate at any semi-decent place...

review_full: I've been to Taberna el Sur several times between fall 2018 and summer 2019 and enjoyed each visit. The staff is friendly, the traditional Spanish food is very good, and the portion sizes are generous. The seating can be a little tight, so I'd recommend arriving early for lunch or dinner or making a reservation ahead of time. I've especially liked the salads, pork cheeks, and grilled squid. The desserts are delicious and I like the passionfruit cake especially.

review_preview: We've innocently strolled in an hour before the kitchen reopened for dinner, only to learn of it, and that the place was booked solid for the next 3 days!Luckily, the super-pleasant Roberto (the main dining room manager), offered us a dinner at the elevated...
review_full: We've innocently strolled in an hour before the kitchen reopened for dinner, only to learn of it, and that the place was booked solid for the next 3 days! Luckily, the super-pleasant Roberto (the main dining room manager), offered us a dinner at the elevated tapas/bar tables. So we had a drink and coffee (arguably the best we have tasted in Madrid!), and Roberto patiently, and professionally answered our menu related questions. So finally it was food time. After some delicious fresh bread, with very tasty olive oil, Tomas, our greatly attentive, and professional server, got us some grilled goat cheese over apple jam, and mixed greens salad. Just awesome! Two of us shared the 1 kilo of T-bone steak, medium, served with roasted potatoes. I heard the sirens sing as I brutalized the steak, as did my companion! It was so good, I am drooling just telling about it Our third companion had the grilled Hake, that came with some vegetables, and got extremely high reviews for taste, aroma, and presentation.  So in summary: amazing food, impeccable service, and a relaxed, friendly, welcoming ambiance. Most recommended!.

Given the quality of food, this is a price performer when compared to restaurants in the US of this quality. The ambience is very quaint, and get a table in the basement. It makes you feel like you're eating in an old wine cellar. I will definitely be returning!

review_preview: It's hard to add anything on the previous reviews but, just to say, I took my mother here for a special meal on Sunday 28th January and it was our highlight of the trip.The restaurant doesn't open until 8.00pm so if you arrive early,...
review_full: It's hard to add anything on the previous reviews but, just to say, I took my mother here for a special meal on Sunday 28th January and it was our highlight of the trip. The restaurant doesn't open until 8.00pm so if you arrive early, you might be welcomed with a 'ham soup' .... but don't worry, the evening gets better and better. The Cave is the place to eat so, if available, request this. The menu, the service, the ambience.....everything is OUTSTANDING. Check the website out for the full menu but I would highly recommend the tapas to start and the entrecote steak of cod as a main. Gin and tonic sorbet to finish is unbelievable. Waiting staff are faultless, the wine list is incredible, location is beautiful. really have nothing negative to say about this wonderful restaurant.

review_preview: We were staying in an airbnb that was only about 50m from the front door, so when we discovered El Sur on our second night, it quickly became our local restaurant for our week long stay in Madrid. You have to queue and you cannot...
review_full: We were staying in an airbnb that was only about 50m from the front door, so when we discovered El Sur on our second night, it quickly became our local restaurant for our week long stay in Madrid. You have to queue and you cannot book, which is quite alien to me, but you soon get used to it, the longest we waited was about 20 minutes on a Sunday evening at peak time. The food is delicious, simple, fresh, honest and great value too, wonderful wines by the glass and a huge array of drinks behind the bar. It seems to be busy all the time, no matter what time you go in at, which is always a good sign. Service is not amazing but was one of the best in Madrid, they made us feel very welcome and we left after each visit with satisfied full bellies. Highlights were tortilla, quiche, calamari, salmon skewers and pork cheek with potatoes. The two salads we had were very heavily dressed so I would recommend to ask for the dressing on the side.

review_full: We were hot, tired, hungry. Saw their amazing-looking Prawns in Sizzling Garlic Oil on Yelp. Slipped in to this groovy tavern, where there seemed to be a lot of regular customers.  Although Chupi’s English is good, he was a great sport about our using an app to speak in Spanish. We ordered the prawns (you’ll want a side of rice to go under this magic sizzling garlic oil) and also chicken curry. Both were so fantastic, we were saving bites so it would last as long as possible. So many creative yet simple and delicious-looking plates went by, we only want to eat at Taberna El Sur for the rest of our time in Madrid.  Chupi and Karina are welcoming, clearly love what they do, and are lots of fun. We don’t drink, but if YOU do, you will flip over their apparently famous specialties.  And all of this, prepared with passion, is affordable. Go hungry, and you will faint from pleasure.

review_preview: After walking for hours around admiring Madrid, we realized we were close to this restaurant that we read about on TA.  We arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 3 pm.  From the outside it does not look like the kind of place we would eat...
review_full: After walking for hours around admiring Madrid, we realized we were close to this restaurant that we read about on TA. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 3 pm. From the outside it does not look like the kind of place we would eat at. We went in and were warmly greeted by the person working the packed counter. This place was hopping busy, but there was a table for two ready for us. Johnny, was our waiter, he is extremely friendly, gave us an English menu and explained the various offerings. Prices are very reasonable, tapa order of Musaka ( very good) was 3 euros, I could have just had that for my meal it was plenty. I ordered a half order of their " Ropa Vieja" a Cuban flavored pulled flank steak which was equally as good. husband ordered a goat cheese walnut salad, I could swear the cheese was Brie, but when in Spain -....... It was satisfying and just what we needed. We were both glad that we made the stop here.

review_full: Based on Trip Advisor reviews we decided to try Taberna el Sur last night. While it did not live up to some of its more gushy reviews, it did offer good food at a good value. Our very friendly waiter, Alex, recommended the filet mignon and mousaka. The filet was tasty as was the mousaka altough it was served at room temperature. Ditto with my wife's ropa vieja, almost as though the stove had been turned off for a while before it was dished out. We will return to Taberna el Sur for its good value and cozy ambience, but with realistic expectations about the cuisine. They are very good at marketing, though, as we were encouraged to post a review on Trip Advisor. Here it is!

review_preview: We came here based on TA recommendation. We arrived here at about 230pm on a Sunday after a visit to the flea market. The place was full but the lady at the bar was really friendly, told us we didn't have to wait long and...
review_full: We came here based on TA recommendation. We arrived here at about 230pm on a Sunday after a visit to the flea market. The place was full but the lady at the bar was really friendly, told us we didn't have to wait long and served us some drinks and olives while waiting. We were directed to a table about 5 min later, and served by this very energetic and jovial young man, Jonne. He gave us suggestions on our food orders, and rightly prevented us from over ordering because all the dishes seemed so yummy. We tried the chicken curry, the steak mignon, the tomato soup, and the salmon skewers. All super yummy. The sangria was really nice too. We really enjoyed the friendly atmosphere which prevailed in this little Taberna el Sur. Jonne even played a tune on the guitar to entertain some small kids at the next table. Wonderful experience! The bill was very reasonable too.

title_review: Served like Kings on 3 Kings Day!
review_preview: A very dreary, cold and rainy Día de los 3 Reyes had us scrambling to find a decent Holiday Meal...enter La Mi Venta tucked away by the Senate building. We had called & they said they were full but we went anyway and we were...
review_full: A very dreary, cold and rainy Día de los 3 Reyes had us scrambling to find a decent Holiday Meal...enter La Mi Venta tucked away by the Senate building. We had called & they said they were full but we went anyway and we were greeted with a nice ham broth a.k.a. Caldo to warm our dampened souls. From there we were shown to a small room off the Tapa bar where we dined like a King, Queen & Princess! We were famished and started ordering like crazy and the excellent waiter had to deduct a dish or two from the order because we were Foodies gone wild at that point... I ordered us a bottle of cava followed by a nice plate of ham, a beautiful Goat Cheese salad, an excellent cold tomato soup from Córdoba, a great steak and a very nice fish by the name of Lubina. Throw in a Strudel for dessert and then the towel for it’s now SIESTA TIME! Nice job La Mi Venta...A very nice job in deed. Bravo!

review_preview: I had made a prior reservation for La Mi Venta as we were a large group of friends visiting Madrid. When we arrived at the restaurant, I realized that I had made the booking on a wrong day but the restaurant manager was kind enough...
review_full: I had made a prior reservation for La Mi Venta as we were a large group of friends visiting Madrid. When we arrived at the restaurant, I realized that I had made the booking on a wrong day but the restaurant manager was kind enough to overlook this error and within a few minutes we were given a long table in a private room downstairs. We had an incredible server who could speak English and this helped a lot in choosing the food and wine. The atmosphere and food were so lovely that we stayed for a good few hours, enjoying our time. One of the best olive oils of the country can be found here in the restaurant both for an order to eat and to buy. We all bought olive oils at the really market-competitive price here. The food was aaahmazing, the wine was divine and the overall experience was truly unforgettable. Be sure to give this place a chance.

review_preview: We reserved a table in the cave. Both dining rooms are below the bar in windowless rooms. The menu here is very confusing, at least for a visitor from the U.S. , eve after a month in Spain. In the first section where one would...
review_full: We reserved a table in the cave. Both dining rooms are below the bar in windowless rooms. The menu here is very confusing, at least for a visitor from the U.S. , eve after a month in Spain. In the first section where one would expect to find appetizers there are various items, some large, some small, some hot, some cold. Our waiter helped us navigate and made suggestions. For entrees we had lamb chops and presa (pork) Iberica. The lamb chops were delicious but had very little meat on the bones, as if most of the lollipop had been cut off the stick. On the other hand, the presa was also delicious and enough for three people. The house red wine was very good. On the whole a pleasant if somewhat uneven experience.

We were "warned" about the waiting time (around one hour), but it was easily worth it - nothing like the pre-cooked microwaved "paella" that you'll (unfortunately) get many other places in Madrid. Also, notice that the price (30€) is for two persons, which makes it a bargain....

review_preview: Following our transatlantic flight we settled into our hotel a few blocks away for a short nap and then sought a leisurely but light meal before trying to set our clocks right with a night of sleep.My wife discovered this lovely spot with separate...
review_full: Following our transatlantic flight we settled into our hotel a few blocks away for a short nap and then sought a leisurely but light meal before trying to set our clocks right with a night of sleep. My wife discovered this lovely spot with separate dining areas but they were not seating until evening. The barkeep spoke English and set us up with cold beers and tapas at a sidewalk table by speading a tablecloth and bringing out a variety of tapas. Delicious! Attentive service before hours had really begun. After our light meal (under $50 for three people!) we took a brief tour of the "cave" and other dining areas. Our 6th trip to Madrid and have rarely enjoyed a stop more. Look forward to having the time and opportunity for a sit-down meal at La Mi Venta!

Between all of us, we had a few bottles of wine and 6 tapas - every single thing was amazing. We had the Huevos Rotos Con Pisto (fried egg on top of chips with a sauce...trust me just try it!), Gambones (shrimp in amazing garlic sauce), Chipirones a la Plancha (very good squid situation), Croquettes (phenomenal), the Jamon Iberico, and one of the specials which was this amazing sauteed beef thing... SO GOOD!!! Our total bill was just over 100 EUR split 6 ways...so for an amazing authentic meal it is 100% worth it. Plus the waiters were all so nice, especially the one from Florida :) Thanks for a great dining experience!!!

review_preview: We arrived early, before the kitchen re-opened for dinner service. We had visited here on our previous trip to Madrid and enjoyed it, so we wanted to return. We sat at one of the outdoor tables on the sidewalk underneath an umbrella. The waiter congenially...
review_full: We arrived early, before the kitchen re-opened for dinner service. We had visited here on our previous trip to Madrid and enjoyed it, so we wanted to return. We sat at one of the outdoor tables on the sidewalk underneath an umbrella. The waiter congenially informed us that we could order tapas that did not involve anything being cooked, as the chef would not return for some time. So, we ordered and enjoyed two very nice tapas; one with “macerated” chopped tomatoes on toasted bread, and one of Iberian ham. The tomatoes on the first dish were truly excellent. They might have even been more flavorful than the tomatoes I grow in my garden at home. Of course the jamon was delicious and was presented in an interesting way (photo). We sat and sipped our beverages for long enough that we were there when the kitchen opened. So we decided to order a couple of plates that we weren’t able to order earlier. One was “special” anchovies tapa, the other a salad with “apple jam and fried goat cheese.” The special anchovies were very large fillets, apparently from somewhere specific, and were quite good. They were swimming in good olive oil and were enjoyable to eat with the crusty bread served alongside. I’m not sure I’d order this again, but we wanted to try something “special.” Meanwhile, the salad was absolute genius; a nice mix of greens with the incredible combination of the cheese and the “apple jam,” which tasted more like pear and made an incredible foil for the fried rounds of goat cheese. These rounds were larger in diameter than typical goat cheese, sliced 3/8 inch thick, and caramelized to a light brown crunch on the exterior, while remaining creamy in the center. Sublime. Overall, a very casual and memorable dining experience…

title_review: True to its 2 Michelin star rating
review_preview: First time to visit Madrid and I wanted to check out a Michelin star restaurant in the city.We were so lucky that there was a one  open  slot on the date we were in Madrid. It took few days for the restaurant to confirm...
review_full: First time to visit Madrid and I wanted to check out a Michelin star restaurant in the city. We were so lucky that there was a one open slot on the date we were in Madrid. It took few days for the restaurant to confirm . On the day of the reservation, restaurant called to confirm our attendance.  Everything about the restaurant was to its perfection. Ambiance, food quality, service are all up to what are expected for a 2 Michelin star restaurant. Added to the experience was a chance to meet the owner and chef, Ramon Freixa himself who was so gracious and accommodating. We ordered the Territory Menu with wine pairing and it was worth the money spent on the food and experience. Food coming to our table seemed endless and yet each item on the menu gives you a different flavor. The wine list complemented everything on the menu.  All in all, this was one gastronomic experience I would love to do again once given the chance to visit Madrid in the future.

review_preview: There are too many points about the quality of the cuisine and the service to comment here, so suffice to say that R. Freixa fully deserves his Michelin stars. Each dish was a small wonder, and tastes and presentations were fantastic. The service is highly...
review_full: There are too many points about the quality of the cuisine and the service to comment here, so suffice to say that R. Freixa fully deserves his Michelin stars. Each dish was a small wonder, and tastes and presentations were fantastic. The service is highly professional and attentive (if not particularly friendly). title_review: Among the best restaurants in Europe.
review_preview: We very much enjoyed Ramon Freixa.  The decor was elegant, the staff were attentive and informative without being stuffy.  We had the experience menu which was great fun and really showed the artistry and skills of the chef without compromising on flavour.  This 20 course...
review_full: We very much enjoyed Ramon Freixa. The decor was elegant, the staff were attentive and informative without being stuffy. We had the experience menu which was great fun and really showed the artistry and skills of the chef without compromising on flavour. This 20 course meal with accompanying wine was sensational. Ramon took our taste buds on a world tour. I particularly enjoyed his nod to his Catalan roots with a menu containing ingredients from Vic and the butifarra.  Although I do love the food and cosiness of the Kitchin in Edinburgh but having eaten in a few Michelin places in Europe this has to be one of the most technically skilled and interesting menus I've seen. Possibly the best one I've been to. The flavours of the dishes were varied from delicate to very rich and the wines chosen really surprised us and perfectly suited the flavours of the food.  A nice touch is that Ramon comes to meet each table to talk about the menu. A wonderful place and a great experience and I hope We get the chance to return again.

title_review: If You Enjoy Fine Dinning - Ramon Freixa is A MUST DO in Madrid.
review_preview: Chef Ramon conjures the magic only possible when there is a real passion for food. Technique, Flavor and Presentation are exceptional as is the service. From the moment you arrive the journey begins and the attention to detail is as you would expect from a...
review_full: Chef Ramon conjures the magic only possible when there is a real passion for food. Technique, Flavor and Presentation are exceptional as is the service. From the moment you arrive the journey begins and the attention to detail is as you would expect from a Michelin 2 Star establishment - flawless. You can tailor your experience so the dialog with Ramon and his sommelier as you settle in for the experience helps divert any disappointments, this is a real nice touch and removes so much pretention you can experience in some other fine dinning establishments. We chose 'The Homage' 25 courses with 13 wine pairings - it was truly exceptional from start to finish. Whatever you choose of the various menu options I am sure Chef Ramon, Sommelier and staff will ensure you have an unforgettable experience. Some of the dishes were truly memorable for us, the Sunken Fois Gras, Just Iberian Pig, to name but two. We have dinned in many 2 and 3 Start restaurants - we would return to Madrid just for another visit!

review_preview: This restaurant is part of a hotel in an upmarket district in Madrid. The dining room is compact and there are not many tables but there was no lack of atmosphere. The room itself is beautifully decorated and we found the service to be very...
review_full: This restaurant is part of a hotel in an upmarket district in Madrid. The dining room is compact and there are not many tables but there was no lack of atmosphere. The room itself is beautifully decorated and we found the service to be very good indeed - cool, professional and efficient but not stuffy. We had the 20 course tasting menu and it was quite an experience! I'm pleased to say that we loved almost everything. As one might expect, several of the dishes are very inventive indeed and presentation is as important as flavour. Snr Freixa himself took the food order and returned later in the evening to see if everything was OK - it was a nice touch. Although individual dishes are small, we were by no means hungry by the end of the night - and we were there for almost three hours! The whole evening was a delight and a perfect end to our holiday in Madrid.

They have lots of vegetarian and vegan options, and the most important thing, they have the best beer in Spain and one of the top in the international ranking: Estrella Galicia.  Don´t miss out in this place, it´ll be so worth it!!

review_preview: I visited El Sitio with my girlfriend for lunch on our first day in Madrid. We had arrived early that morning via overnight bus and were hungry and tired when we headed out from our hostel. TripAdvisor highly recommended El Sitio, so we made the...
review_full: I visited El Sitio with my girlfriend for lunch on our first day in Madrid. We had arrived early that morning via overnight bus and were hungry and tired when we headed out from our hostel. TripAdvisor highly recommended El Sitio, so we made the short journey northwards to check it out. We were the first customers of the day, reaching around 1 pm. The waiter did not speak English, and as we did not speak Spanish, we tried to communicate with hand gestures. In a few moments, the waiter excused himself, and the chef (who spoke English) came out to converse with us. We were served and waited upon by him for the rest of the afternoon.  We ordered a meal of the day, along with a margherita pizza. As part of the meal of the day, I chose a caprese salad (which was not originally included in the options, but since I am vegetarian, the chef agreed to serve it to me), the olivia pizza and a glass of red wine. All the food was delicious and we stuffed ourselves more than we should have! All in all, I would recommend this restaurant highly, and would gladly go back next time I visit Madrid.

review_full: We are very pleased with the lovely meal we had today. Service was excellent and our waiter spoke very good English. The reason I'm giving only 4 out of 5 stars is that all the food we ordered (goat cheese salad, chorizo and a little pincho presa iberica as a side dish) came to the table at different times. I got my salad first when my aunt still had to wait for her chorizo, and when we had both finished, the waiter brought the side dish to the table. If I would have known that there was such a long wait for some of the food, I would't have ordered all of it. Apart from that, I was very pleased with my experience. Thank you!

review_preview: This is another Casa Paco. A place that has been here a while, but appears to survive on it's reputation from Yester-Year. The staff here, or certainly the individual who served us, behaved in a way that implied it was His evening and not ours;...
review_full: This is another Casa Paco. A place that has been here a while, but appears to survive on it's reputation from Yester-Year. The staff here, or certainly the individual who served us, behaved in a way that implied it was His evening and not ours; basically, whatever suited Him better! Ever heard of a Restaurant Waiter that does not allow you to taste a Wine 'by the glass' for approval, because it is 'by the glass'???!!!!! Incredible behaviour! The same person was also concerned because we wanted a drink and to relax outside before we sat and dined, an hour before our booked time...we took the hint, walked and gave another bar our money around the corner. Anyway, the Wine 'by the Glass' was mediocre to poor, we just had the One.As for the food: Padron peppers were tiny with little seasoning or flavour, the Steak for two, which our illustrious waiter insisted on as opposed to the individual pieces we initially requested, was tough and overall average. I think it was served with fried potatoes, but the whole thing was so dull, I cannot honestly remember. I'll just put it down to (poor) experience and judgement on my behalf.

title_review: Always the best. For us among european tops
review_preview: Ramon Freixa surprises us every time we are going. The whole stuff and if course Ramon adorable. It starts always great with the bread offered..... As a german citizen you might suffer with bread in Spain. Well not here, the bread brought in freshly from...
review_full: Ramon Freixa surprises us every time we are going. The whole stuff and if course Ramon adorable. It starts always great with the bread offered..... As a german citizen you might suffer with bread in Spain. Well not here, the bread brought in freshly from Ramons father is just amazing. My favourite in Madrid. I have read complaints about the restaurant being pricey. The opposite us true compared to very other big european city. Trust the young sommelier , he is among the best in Spain..... Challenge him and trust him...... Today only spanish wines but i do not feel like drinking a Verdejo or Albariño...... Offer ne sth different..... The sommelier will not disappoint you.... It is right there is no view from the restaurant, however there is a small garden. Look on the creations on your plate. They are besides great and delicious always an artistic eyecatch. Finest european glasses ( Baccarat etc) and stoneware ( Hermes etc) are the rule. Atmossphere however is not royal but funny and relaxed. Everybody just wants you to enjoy the food. And it is easy to enjoy it.......the only thing that could be a little better are the deserts. They are very good though but well lets say they fall back from teo to ine star. No problem as some if the main plates are rather on a three star level than a two star level. So amazing food!

Book early since they only have a set amount of space but worth going for a special occasion.

Open tomorrow-public holiday in Spain- Thursday October 12, 2017. Glorious weather - close to thirty degrees -no wind. Now heading off for dinner -if we have space - to Fiaschetteria La Saletta - upstairs in Mercado something or other - like a food hall as we say in my country - one black next to Cine Dore (Indy cinema complex- for film buffs- wow). review_preview: Taberna Mas al Sur provides decent Spanish food for a very reasonable price. The service is friendly and attentive, and service staff can communicate in English easily. As for the food. Wow. The serving sizes are tremendous for tapas. However, the food itself is relatively...
review_full: Taberna Mas al Sur provides decent Spanish food for a very reasonable price.  The service is friendly and attentive, and service staff can communicate in English easily.  As for the food. Wow. The serving sizes are tremendous for tapas. However, the food itself is relatively bland for Spanish standards, as I was hoping for a bit more flavour. Maybe it might just be what I ordered, but whilst the food was satisfying, it wasn't the most memorable culinary experience of that day in Madrid.  On the contrary, the wine is excellent, plentiful, and liberally poured, making it excellent value for money.  Overall, a fantastic experience.

We ordered fried eggplant, shrimp with garlic (gambas al ajillo), risotto, and a steak dish. All of them were delicious and the price was reasonable given the tourist location. What set this restaurant apart, though, was the service. Everybody that attended us was super friendly. They really made me feel at home. They ended the night with a complimentary piña colada shot, which was just the right level of sweetness. I would definitely come back!

title_review: A hiccup made up for by a good meal
review_preview: We looked for somewhere special in Madrid for a nice dinner and booked a table at this restaurant via the internet. The only availability was at 9:00pm. On the evening of our booking, we turned up and were told that there was no table for...
review_full: We looked for somewhere special in Madrid for a nice dinner and booked a table at this restaurant via the internet. The only availability was at 9:00pm. On the evening of our booking, we turned up and were told that there was no table for us. We were utterly surprised to hear this. The staff in reception then told us that an email message was sent tout at 7:00 pm to let us know that there was no availability. How on earth could they possibly expect their customers to check their email only 2 hours before the time of their booking? Did they not take into account that people have to get themselves ready, then have to travel somehow to the restaurant? Upset and frustrated, especially when we didn't know where else to go for our meal, we were about to leave then they told us that some one didn't turn up for their table and that they could give us that table. The mess-up, however, was made up for a rather excellent meal. What was most impressive was that Ramon Frexa himself waked around to greet his customers and took the orders himself. He then walked into the kitchen to work on the food. As the restaurant is not large, and the number of tables and diners limited, the service was very personal with many special touches. The food was amazingly innovative and was so beautifully presented and was full of exquisite flavours. Some of the courses were not simple dishes but unfolded in several 'acts', each one was a surprise for the mind, the eye and the palate. We ended up having a great experience at this place, to which we shall return. But we will check our e-mail inbox or ring them before we set off. Better still, we will be cautious and will also book elsewhere in case there is no table for us. We would have liked to give the top mark to this place, but could not do so because of the hiccup.

review_preview: What can I say? Absolutely delicious!!! I love Peruvian food and I'm often disappointed by restaurants I go to that claim to be Peruvian. I've been to London based eateries that have been double the cost but bland as hell and not authentic. Kausa Madrid...
review_full: What can I say? Absolutely delicious!!! I love Peruvian food and I'm often disappointed by restaurants I go to that claim to be Peruvian. I've been to London based eateries that have been double the cost but bland as hell and not authentic. Kausa Madrid was incredible....and i don't say that lightly. Ten years after my time in Lima, this was hands down the best ceviche I've had. It legitimately brought back memories! The causa I had was also delicious, as were the courses my partner chose, which were the papa rellena and the classic, lomo saltado. Visit this restaurant and you will not regret it. Shout out to the friendly service too, and the geniune pisco sours.

title_review: Perfect end to our Spanish holiday!!
review_preview: After spending 5 days in Haro we ended our trip with 3 days in Madrid. We really wanted to have a good authentic Spanish paella. After looking in trip adviser we found this little place. Upon arrival we was greeted by our waiter Enrique who...
review_full: After spending 5 days in Haro we ended our trip with 3 days in Madrid. We really wanted to have a good authentic Spanish paella. After looking in trip adviser we found this little place. Upon arrival we was greeted by our waiter Enrique who was everything you could want in a waiter. He was polite and helpful and very attentive. I can't praise him enough for his service. We had a stater of mixed chorizo and cheese and it was lovely. We then order a paella ( $29- brilliant value) and it was beautiful, the king prawns tasted like they had just been pulled from the sea. Best paella I've ever had. Throughout our meal we was given little tapas and at the end a little dessert.( non of which we was charged for) We ordered a bottle of wine from a winery we had visited earlier on in the holiday, and it was decanted and poured for us. The whole evening was wonderful and in truth I'm a little sad this is our last evening as I would be returning here.

I an only recommend, but do expect to pay more than average in Madrid, realising that the quality delivered is beyond average as well!

review_preview: Great show in the heart of the city. Our local guide recommended this spot.  The venue is small so all seats are close to the stage. Some guests are next to stage for those who choose beverage and show.  The dinner guests were seated one...
review_full: Great show in the heart of the city. Our local guide recommended this spot. The venue is small so all seats are close to the stage. Some guests are next to stage for those who choose beverage and show. The dinner guests were seated one off the stage and a little better seat/ perspective. They offer a dinner menu with points for each item to choose from. Couples who are sharing can order several items for the allowed points. We chose chicken paella, Iberian ham, manchego, vegetable salad of red peppers and desserts were included too. Two glasses of wine or one alcoholic beverage per person. The food was good but the show was great. It starts out a little show but they increase the intensity as they perform. It’s a two hour dinner/show and a great way to experience some of the culture of Madrid.

review_preview: Not to preach to the choir, as Trip Advisor was our source to try this little restaurant for dinner. The sign to the right of the door was filled with photos of niños y niñas. And a one table sat four children, with the five...
review_full: Not to preach to the choir, as Trip Advisor was our source to try this little restaurant for dinner. The sign to the right of the door was filled with photos of niños y niñas. And a one table sat four children, with the five adults at an adjacent table. After asking for menus in English, I ordered the tuna belly salad, a great combination of tuna, tomatoes, pepper, and beans with olive oil. My Bride ordered the bonito. Neither plate was empty when dinner was served, as the portions were more than enough to satisfy two hungry travelers. The fifth star was earned by one of the adult men, who communicated with broken English, French, and Spanish, offered the Bride a glass of wine from his bottle. The verdict was the house wine was good, but his was far better. When his supper was finished, we hugged him in thanks.  That is what made the meal so special, and why we are travelers and not tourists. ¡Muchas gracias!

There was also a shrimp in garlic oil dish that was perfect with crusty bread at the table to dip into the garilc oil. The staff were also extremely friendly. We had.a waitress from Venezuela whose name I forget, and also spoke a number of times with Carlos. Carlos actually brought us some complimentary crema de orujo digestif, which is a Galician liquor that tasted a lot like Bailey's Irish Cream.

Just a few of us in there at American dinner time, which let us take some extra time with the bartender without compromising service to others. Note to those with stomachs on US time - hot food doesn't start until 8pm. But the cold snacks were plenty for the first hour of drinking.

title_review: We didn't eat here, but the flamenco was SO MUCH FUN!
review_preview: We were roaming around the area one weeknight with a friend who was visiting (my husband and I live in Madrid), and walked into Mister Pinkleton by chance. The 15 euro/person price of the flamenco show, including a drink, was too good to resist, and...
review_full: We were roaming around the area one weeknight with a friend who was visiting (my husband and I live in Madrid), and walked into Mister Pinkleton by chance. The 15 euro/person price of the flamenco show, including a drink, was too good to resist, and the place was so inviting and cozy. The show itself (consisting of a guitarist, a male and female dancer, and a female singer) was one of the most enjoyable flamenco performances I have seen! (And I've seen several, in Madrid and in Seville). The performers were full of joy and enthusiasm, and had wonderful rapport. They even invited the audience to sing along with some of the songs, which was great fun! The staff at the restaurant were also super-nice. I will definitely come here again, and bring friends. I just hope that they don't raise the price and become like the other commercial, over-expensive tablaos that abound in Madrid!

review_preview: If you would like to dine at a traditional neighborhood tavern in Madrid, one of the very best is La Pinta y La Viña (the Pint and the Vine). It is owned by Emilio (a most cordial host) and Toñi (the talented chef). While high...
review_full: If you would like to dine at a traditional neighborhood tavern in Madrid, one of the very best is La Pinta y La Viña (the Pint and the Vine). It is owned by Emilio (a most cordial host) and Toñi (the talented chef). While high quality beers on tap and in bottles are available, the tavern is dedicated to wine. The wine list is long and interesting with many wines available by the glass. The flavorful food includes traditional dishes such as croquetas, tortilla de patatas, and menestra de verduras. On Monday through Friday midday, a “menú del día” (set price meal) is served which includes two courses, bread, wine, and dessert (or coffee) for €12. Recently, my meal was bread, a bottle of wine to share with my wife, lentil stew, pork scaloppini with salad, and dessert. Delicious! Richard Tubbs Coralville, Iowa, USA

review_full: We passed by here and the host told us we needed a reservation, so Sunday was my last day in Madrid, I woke up early and made a reservation for us, which was $30 per person. This one included one drink per person, but we ended up ordering more drinks and also food. I was hopeless on finding vegan options here, but they had a veggie paella that was really good. It's a little pricey, but absolutely worth it. Show was breath taking, and of course it's better if you speak spanish and are able to understand what they sing like us. Eduardo was out waiter, and the service was quick and great. He even took some pictures of us when the show ended. This is a place that I'll go back to every time I visit Madrid.

title_review: Fair food, but very fun Flamenco
review_preview: Yeah, yeah, I know that Sevilla is the birthplace of Flamenco, but we had a very intimate and accomplished performance by a Flamenco troupe (from Sevilla), along with a passable meal, at Madrid’s La Taberna de Mister Pinkleton, just off Plaza Mayor.  We sat just...
review_full: Yeah, yeah, I know that Sevilla is the birthplace of Flamenco, but we had a very intimate and accomplished performance by a Flamenco troupe (from Sevilla), along with a passable meal, at Madrid’s La Taberna de Mister Pinkleton, just off Plaza Mayor. We sat just a few feet from the singers and dancers, and they were enthusiastic performers. You are given a number of "points" to spend on your meal. Truffled mashed potatoes are one point; pickled chicken breast is two points, etc. Our waitress was a hoot. She was from Romania, spoke perfect, if slangy, English, and was quite opinionated about all kinds of things. It was all a fun evening.

review_preview: I had been searching for the perfect Flamenco show and our wine tasting tour guide actually suggested Mr. Pinkleton. I'm so glad we listened and made the reservation. The show was phenomenal! We booked an "early" show at 7:30p, so we could grab dinner nearby...
review_full: I had been searching for the perfect Flamenco show and our wine tasting tour guide actually suggested Mr. Pinkleton. I'm so glad we listened and made the reservation. The show was phenomenal! We booked an "early" show at 7:30p, so we could grab dinner nearby in Plaza Mayor after. They do have a dinner and a show ticket or just dinner and drink. No matter what they give you some snacks to go with your drinks. It's a very small venue but we got lucky and sat front and center to this awesome show. The service was fast and great & didn't interfere with the performance on stage. The dancers and singers put on such a great show and I will return for another show next time I'm in Madrid!

The food is good, service great.

review_preview: Wanted a good dinner and a fine flamenco show and got both. The tapas here are delicious: We had excellent cheese plate, Spanish omelette, Russian salad, and paella, followed by cheese cake for my wife and a sinfully delicious chocolate cake for me. The show...

The show is phenomenal: This production shows that flamenco is more than castenets and stomping feet. It's a small cabaret in a picturesque part of town near Plaza Major and should not be missed. Make reservations. It's possible just to have drinks and watch the show, instead of the full dinner. Show is less than 2 hours, so squeeze this experience into your itinerary; you won't regret it and will regret missing it!

title_review: Superb Flamenco Performers... Not A Tourist Act, The Real Deal!
review_preview: Truly one of our most memorable evenings in Madrid! My wife and I were on a month-long driving adventure through Spain, Portugal and Morocco. We ended our travels in Madrid. We were seeking an authentic Flamenco performance for our last night and our hotel concierge...
review_full: Truly one of our most memorable evenings in Madrid! My wife and I were on a month-long driving adventure through Spain, Portugal and Morocco. We ended our travels in Madrid. We were seeking an authentic Flamenco performance for our last night and our hotel concierge thankfully recommended this terrific venue. We were enthralled by a most impressive 2-hour show with a brief intermission. The theater is casual and intimate, so there isn't a bad seat in the house. About half the attendees were locals and the others tourists. Guests can choose the show with or without dinner service. We wanted to focus on the performances and were glad we decided on just cocktails (the first drink is included in the ticket price -- for two people with 2 cocktails each about 80 Euros with taxes ). This was not the typical canned money grab show for tourists. The performers were all consummate professionals and displayed a genuine passion for their art. I came to learn that most Flamenco in Spain is done by independent artists rather than traveling intact groups. Much like professional jazz musicians, each performer has attained a high-level of mastery and knows well the standard repertoire. The performances are often spontaneous and can even be without rehearsal. Wow, my wife and I were in genuine awe of the flair, speed and accuracy of the guitarist, the percussion, the vocals and of course the dancers. Absolutely amazing performances by all. A most impressive experience we will be talking about for years. Highly recommended.

title_review: A must do on your visit to Madrid - Flamenco and tapas
review_preview: It is shamefull that living in Madrid most of the year, I only do this kind of visit when friends from abroad come to visit. I dont know why locals like me dont do it every week... its a super nice Flamenco experince, in a...
review_full: It is shamefull that living in Madrid most of the year, I only do this kind of visit when friends from abroad come to visit. I dont know why locals like me dont do it every week... its a super nice Flamenco experince, in a privileged location next to the Plaza mayor and the food and tapas are very good. Actually I have decided to start bringing in locals so they know about it too...it cant be a pleasure only for tourists. I have seen many flamenco shows and have friends that make a living teaching flamenco and the dancers and singers at La Taberna de Mr Pilkleton were awesome. If you want to have a true Flamenco experience on your Madrid trip, ... reserve a table on the taberna. By the way I found the price very reasonable and the jamon ( spanish jam) very good. and for a spaniard that means a lot !!!

review_full: My husband and our two young kids had dinner here tonight. It’s a low key neighborhood place serving up dishes with a lot of flavor and love. Service was great too. Simple things like their roast chicken, which our kids enjoyed, was seasoned well and cooked just right to keep it juicy, even the white meat. We enjoyed the zesty ceviche and other raw fish. We also looooved the seafood rice dish with wine (similar to paella). Plate-licking good. The dessert was fantastic as well, a cheesecake-like dish. Everything was very reasonably priced. Highly recommend.

title_review: Such good food, such unobtrusive service: highly recommended.
review_preview: Five of us went for dinner in Kausa and thoroughly enjoyed it. We picked several dishes to share, and the waitress said honestly that she thought what we had chosen would be enough (I like it when no-one tries to sell you more). We had...
review_full: Five of us went for dinner in Kausa and thoroughly enjoyed it. We picked several dishes to share, and the waitress said honestly that she thought what we had chosen would be enough (I like it when no-one tries to sell you more). We had the mixed ceviche (SO flavorful), lamb "seco a la norteña", causa limeña and causa vegetal. The causa limeña was the better causa... in the end, we asked for another dish of the ceviche it was so good. We then tried the mixed dessert plate, where the only thing that really stood out was the passionfruit mousse, which was amazing. They were also kind enough to bring us some cake that we hadn't even ordered (and they didn't charge for)! Oh, last word: the pisco sours were excellent. Very balanced. And the service was a plus as well: there when you needed them, but they let us enjoy our meal in peace. Highly recommended.

As we walked in I looked around to see what others were eating. It looked like everyone was having something different. We sat down and I examined the wine list. It had a variety of moderately priced wines that I knew were very good plus a few expensive bottles. I was thirsty and when I saw the people at the next table drinking tall cold beers, I decided that beer was right for this meal. We started with the fish ceviche. One of my buddies from grad school is Peruvian and her dad made wonderful ceviche. This was even better. It was the best ceviche that either of us had ever eaten. The ceviche had a choice of spice level and we chose "medium", without really knowing what that meant. A small bowl of the spicy liquid came along side and, in moderation, added a terrific flavor. A good start to the meal and a good match with the beer. For our main course we split a potato thingie that was not fried and had some good stuff on top. We also had the fried mixed seafood which came with octopus, shrimp and a bunch of relatively mild white fishes. And hunks of what I think was yuca. Excellent! Not at all greasy and full of flavor. The servings were large and we split the three dishes and had no room for dessert. This is a great little restaurant!

Would definitely visit again next time I'm in Madrid.

Don’t miss this spot when you are in Madrid

We had a lovely table but was a bit too quiet downstairs as very low music level - I know this is something that not everyone approves of but being a bit louder would have lifted the atmosphere. We did have some very good meals - one of the standout ones being the hake for a main course plus one of our party had white chocolate brownie which was lovely. Perhaps try the Manchego cheese for dessert - you get lots and goes down well with lovely red wine. Personally we had a better meal elsewhere in Madrid but a table for 6 on a Saturday night is a little tricky to find and pre- book. We may had a a bad night - there was a hen party in too round the corner so perhaps that was why the service was a little sluggish too

There was not one thing we tried that was not fantastic - the sangria is the best we've had! Also, the service was spectacular. Carlos and Franck were great, they worked quickly and efficiently but at the same time were personal and warm. Carlos, in particular, made our night! He made great conversation with us and was super sweet! At the end of the main course, we were so full we decided to forego dessert. And he came out with a passionfruit cheesecake and Bailey's shots on the house for us - and it was incredibly good! Will remember this place for a long time, and can't wait to go back - it is a must if you're in Madrid!

review_preview: Sometimes it's the combination of ambiance, food, wine and presentation that makes a meal great. We had one of those meals here.Our table was in the vaulted downstairs dining room surrounded by original brick walls and hooks from which hams were once hung to...
review_full: Sometimes it's the combination of ambiance, food, wine and presentation that makes a meal great. We had one of those meals here. Our table was in the vaulted downstairs dining room surrounded by original brick walls and hooks from which hams were once hung to dry. The area is small but not crowded with plenty of space between the tables for privacy. The upstairs bar has many hams hanging and there's a good size charcoal grill there too. Like much Spanish cooking the presentation is quite simple but it's the quality of ingredients and care in cooking that shines through here. We had the Iberian tapas to start and the acorn-fed pork for main. All of this, and the desserts which followed, were delicious. The staff were attentive and helpful without being pushy and seemed genuinely keen that we should have the best possible experience. We chatted with the owner, the son of the parents who established the restaurant in 1962, before we left and his enthusiasm for the quality of what he offered to guests was apparent. I'm sure you could find restaurants with (perhaps) finer dining, a more impressive location, or whose staff spoke perfect English, but I think for a great meal in Madrid you'd be hard pressed to find something better than this for a memorable Spanish dining experience. Very highly recommended.

Go early and don't miss the carrot cake for dessert!

title_review: My new favorite restaurant in Madrid!!!
review_preview: I lived in Madrid for 2 years previously and returned this November with my wife.....we were looking for a nice romantic dinner in a traditional Spanish restaurant.....this place had exactly what we wanted but with a contemporary twist as well.  We ate in a 200...
review_full: I lived in Madrid for 2 years previously and returned this November with my wife.....we were looking for a nice romantic dinner in a traditional Spanish restaurant.....this place had exactly what we wanted but with a contemporary twist as well. We ate in a 200 year old meat cellar downstairs. Staff were incredibly professional and friendly....decent command of English. Calamari was perfectly lightly breaded and served fresh and hot. Ceviche and scallop salad was delicious. T-bone was extremely tasty and juicy. We had this cream cheese dessert which was insanely tasty. Waiter recommended a nice bottle of red wine. The entire meal cost around $120 which I regard as good value for money in a top end restaurant. I will definitely come back here any visit to Madrid. I promise you won't be disappointed. Book in advance.

There is an 8 o'clock show (great for a jumping off point for a Madrid night) and there is a 10 o'clock show that lasts until past midnight. Very worth the ticket to see it.

review_preview: My husband and I decided we couldn’t pass up a Flamenco performance while in Spain.  We decided on La Taberna de Mister Pinkerton because of the review ratings. It was a quaint place with room for about 50 people. The tables were very close to...
review_full: My husband and I decided we couldn’t pass up a Flamenco performance while in Spain. We decided on La Taberna de Mister Pinkerton because of the review ratings.  It was a quaint place with room for about 50 people. The tables were very close to each other but it was too bad. We were served drinks and two little bowls of snacks. ( Our drink came with the ticket price) The wine was ok but maybe you could have order something better as I saw a small bar area. We did not go to the dinner show so can’t review that. The performance was good but if you’re not fluent in Spanish forget understanding what they are saying. The performers that did speak spoke so fast we couldn’t even catch one word. I guess words don’t matter when the story is told through dance and song. The dancers were entertaining, singers ok, and the guitarist was very good. We spent more time watching his finger work the strings then the dancers. I wish there had been more of a variety in dancers. The two that did dance were good but I’m sure there are many more personal styles. It’s worth the 30 euros for a couple hours of entertainment.

The food was the best sit down meal we had in Madrid - we had the cheese and iberico ham to start and then had the beef and pork as mains. The portion sizes were substantial with neither of us having room for dessert (unfortunately as they looked yummy!). I would definitely recommend this restaurant - it's not in the main centre but is worth the stroll out.

Try the Crema Orujo (Spain’s version of Bailey’s). Friendly & professional service, authentic Spanishn cuisine, and generous portions all at a reasonable price. Hope the rest of our restaurant meals in Spain can compare with Mas Al Sur!

review_preview: We visited La Mi Venta to celebrate a birthday after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and are so glad we did! The restaurant has some tables outside on the street with two dining rooms inside downstairs. If we hadn't read about it we probably would...
review_full: We visited La Mi Venta to celebrate a birthday after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and are so glad we did! The restaurant has some tables outside on the street with two dining rooms inside downstairs. If we hadn't read about it we probably would have passed it by as it didn't have any menus on obvious show outside. The restaurant was really close to our hotel which was on the Plaza Oriente, opposite the Royal Palace. We booked a table through Trip Advisor in the cave dining room. The dining room is atmospheric and small seating only 18 people and we were really pleased with our choice. The waiting staff were very welcoming and polite .They gave advise on the menu and drink choices and were very knowledgable about the dishes and ingredients. We had bread and olive oil, a Main course and dessert each with a jug of Sangria and bottle of water and the bill came to 69 euros which was very reasonable for the quality of food. It felt like fine dining on a mid-range budget. All the food was beautifully presented and delicious..we left nothing on our plates! The toffee pudding was recommended by the waiter and was absolutely divine. This is a real gem of a restautant and we would recommend to anyone.  We found it a lovely way to celebrate my husband's 50th birthday.

William and Gustavo were the perfect hosts!! They translated the menu to the majority of the party. We had a little bit of everything and the food was absolutely amazing!! The risottos were devine. The Ropa de Vieja was so good that we ordered a second helping. The sangria was, as we were told, the best in Madrid and we agree wholeheartedly. If you are looking for great food, a great ambiance, and great hosts, then find your way to the Taverna Mas Al Sur!! You will be glad you did!!

review_preview: My husband and I were in Spain for two weeks back in September of 2018. We mainly did Barcelona but did take a short trip to other cities which of course included Madrid. A relative of mine had visited Madrid a few months before we...
review_full: My husband and I were in Spain for two weeks back in September of 2018. We mainly did Barcelona but did take a short trip to other cities which of course included Madrid. A relative of mine had visited Madrid a few months before we did. She posted pictures of the Flamenco show she saw here at Mister Pinkleton's, so definitely we had to check it out. I made the reservation a few weeks before we left. We only did the show and drinks we did not have the food so cannot comment on that. We loved the place. It is small but just right for flamenco show. We got a nice little table right in the middle so we were able to see everything with no one blocking us. We went on a Friday night so it was a full house. The show is awesome. From the guitar player to all the dancers and singers. I loved it was not a quick show and we really enjoyed ourselves. I love towards the end when they ask for volunteers from the audience to go up on stage and do some flamenco dancing. We had a great time and definitely will recommend to friends and family.

review_preview: Me and my girlfriend visited this restaurant for my birthday meal. I chose this restaurant because of the reviews on here and i'm pleased to say, it did not disappoint!! We dined in "the cave" - the whole feel of the place from the minute...
review_full: Me and my girlfriend visited this restaurant for my birthday meal. I chose this restaurant because of the reviews on here and i'm pleased to say, it did not disappoint!!  We dined in "the cave" - the whole feel of the place from the minute we arrived to the moment we left was fantastic. The service was absolutely impeccable - Carlos, the waiter - helped us with things we didn't understand on the menu, and spoke perfect English (which was good for us because we speak very little spanish). When we ordered our wine, he gave us its history and told us all abut the flavours we could expect, he also did this with the oil for the bread - i've never seen a man so passionate about oil, Haha! He also had a really loud, arrogant customer on the next table which he handle very very well!  The food was lovely, i had the Sea bass and my girlfriend has the Hake, both came with veg which was roasted to perfection. We tried each others and both agreed they were fantastic. On to the desert, i ordered the toffee - which i'll be honest i didn't enjoy - my girlfriend on the other hand absolutely loved it, so i ate her white chocolate brownies which were To. Die. For!!! review_preview: We visited this place after the Reina Sofia museum as it was nearby and highly rated on TripAdvisor. Even though the place was packed when we got here, it only took about 5 mins for us to get a table. This was great, especially because...
review_full: We visited this place after the Reina Sofia museum as it was nearby and highly rated on TripAdvisor. Even though the place was packed when we got here, it only took about 5 mins for us to get a table. This was great, especially because there were 2 groups of people in front of us waiting for a table as well.  The place is quite small, but it has a great atmosphere. We enjoyed every moment of our lunch there. The waiters were very helpful and we went along with their recommendation for a red wine, which paid off.  For food, we got a tuna tartar to start with, and it was absolutely delicious. After that, we got the grilled octopus, beef secret and chicken curry. Everybody was more than happy with their food. We all tried all the food on the table and agreed that everything was just delicious.  We were unable to order some dessert as well because we were full, but I wish we could, we would have certainly been impressed.  This place is the best lunch I had in Madrid and definitely shouldn’t be missed if you’re around either Prado or Reina Sofia.

review_preview: The staff here are very friendly and happy to help you navigate the menu and wine list. Not being familiar with Spanish wines, we asked for advice, and had a delicious rosé. For starters we had the anchovies (from the north coast, and delicious), and...
review_full: The staff here are very friendly and happy to help you navigate the menu and wine list. Not being familiar with Spanish wines, we asked for advice, and had a delicious rosé.  For starters we had the anchovies (from the north coast, and delicious), and the grilled green peppers. The peppers were an enormous serve, we couldn't finish them.  Meat is their specialty, but we opted for the paella. It was very good. My only critiques would be there wasn't a single pipi (clam) in any of the shells on my plate (or within the rice) and the paella was almost cold by the time we got to it. I think this was as the waiter served it from the pan onto plates for us, this took some time, and the plates used were cold. I'd suggest they need to serve it onto warmed plates to help retain some temperature.  We had the Gin and Tonic sorbet for dessert which was delicious.  Certainly worth going, we booked online and scored a great table downstairs in the old curing room. Thanks to all the staff.

I will say that the service was outstanding.

title_review: Excellent Flamenco performance - singing, dancing, musicians
review_preview: My husband and I found this tavern while wandering around the HIGHLY recommended Calle Cuchilleros area for tapas.  We were drawn in by the fun name, and then learned that they have dinner/shows.  There are three show times nightly, and we chose the first -...
review_full: My husband and I found this tavern while wandering around the HIGHLY recommended Calle Cuchilleros area for tapas. We were drawn in by the fun name, and then learned that they have dinner/shows. There are three show times nightly, and we chose the first - at 7pm. I can't imagine how they do three shows nightly unless there are different dancers, because it was VERY high energy and passionate! Really fun, and not very long - so you get a good sampling of the music, dance, and singing while enjoying drinks and - if you want - food. We didn't order the dinner to begin with, but then decided to order some things off the menu. Tasty!  There was even an audience participation part of the show, where some ladies were invited up to learn a few moves. Most of the show is in Spanish, with just a little English here and there, so I was glad I didn't miss being able to participate on stage - they came around and asked us in English too - because I didn't understand what was being asked of us at first :) You don't need to know Spanish to participate - just do it! It's fun!

title_review: Good Show, Great Dancer and Very Good Musicians & Singers
review_preview: We wanted to see a flamenco show while we are here in Madrid, and picked this show due to it’s proximity to our hotel.  Made the reservation online for the 7PM show, arrived a few minutes early, got in the queue and were seated within...
review_full: We wanted to see a flamenco show while we are here in Madrid, and picked this show due to it’s proximity to our hotel. Made the reservation online for the 7PM show, arrived a few minutes early, got in the queue and were seated within 15 minutes. I’ve read some other reviews herein about the Sangria not being good - but my wife and I both had a glass and it was quite good. I’ve also read reviews herein about the performers lacking “passion”, not true, these people were very passionate about the music and their performances. The guitarist was very, very good, and the guitarist is the backbone of a flamenco dancer’s performance. The main dancer was very good, she was lithe and sinuous on the dance floor and really made the performance entertaining for everyone. My wife and I would recommend this show to anyone who comes to Madrid, central location and easy to get to.

Overall, fair value, we thought for the food, drink and a 90 minute show.

review_preview: My family and I are touring Spain and staying at Hotel Raphael. Mas al Sur was just about a mile walk from our hotel and easy to find with google maps.We were greeted by a very pleasant gentleman who immediately gave us a menu...
review_full: My family and I are touring Spain and staying at Hotel Raphael.  Mas al Sur was just about a mile walk from our hotel and easy to find with google maps. We were greeted by a very pleasant gentleman who immediately gave us a menu in English. We ordered the Sangria pitcher, and it was the best Sangria we had in all of Spain. The pitcher was filled with fresh blackberries and oranges, and perfectly seasoned over ice. Then for the three adults, we split the Mediterranean salad, pork Rojas, beef tenderloin, and seafood paella. This was so much food, but absolutely delicious. Hands down the best paella in Madrid.  For dessert we split a very decadent piece of cheesecake with blueberries and had three shots of Baileys. The walk back to the hotel was very much needed!  I would return to Mas al Sur in a heartbeat! Everything was perfection!

They seemed to appreciate our efforts to speak Spanish.

title_review: Wish I could give more than excellent!
review_preview: Decided to try this restaurant given its great reviews on tripadvisor and it definitely did not disappoint. The staff welcomed us as soon as we walked in the door and their attentiveness continued throughout dinner. We ordered several tapas and the food was very delicious....
review_full: Decided to try this restaurant given its great reviews on tripadvisor and it definitely did not disappoint. The staff welcomed us as soon as we walked in the door and their attentiveness continued throughout dinner. We ordered several tapas and the food was very delicious. Johnny, Edgar, and Carla were the friendliest staff we experienced while in Madrid. We stayed for hours, and the night even ended with a few acoustic songs by Johnny. Would definitely recommend for anyone looking for good food and fantastic service! Worth the trip even if it's not in the neighborhood you're staying in!

review_full: You'll be lucky to have Javier as your waiter at this authentic and flawless restaurant near the Palacio Real. Although we had sampled tapas all over Madrid and were not terribly hungry when we arrived, we devoured the Padron peppers, ham croquettes and the chorizo from hell, aptly named and flaming hot. With Javier's suggestion we had the "secret meat" dish which was the most delicious pork we've ever had. We also enjoyed the grilled vegetables and the green salad spiked with goat cheese and baked apple. Not to be missed. The meal ended with a sampling of homemade liqueurs, the best of which was the homemade Bailey's alternative that was much better than the original. the entire experience was outstanding, from the gracious and professional service to the food and all the way down to suggestions on where to go for a meal on a day trip to Toledo. Do yourself a favor and do not miss an opportunity to dine at this fine establishment.

title_review: Amazing Experience on our First Night in Madrid!
review_preview: Found this spot using Yelp and Google Maps on our first night in Madrid! I was starving and this place looked promising. I’m SO happy we got to come here, it was quite busy but we were able to get seated fairly quickly at the...
review_full: Found this spot using Yelp and Google Maps on our first night in Madrid! I was starving and this place looked promising. I’m SO happy we got to come here, it was quite busy but we were able to get seated fairly quickly at the bar (best spot!)— they offered us a table a few minutes later but I said the bar was fine :) We ordered the Tortilla de Patata comes with a really good white sauce (Must get!!), a Jarra de Sangria (delicious), Hamon Croquetas (comes with many! And my fiancé’s favorite dish) and the pork cheek dish (also must get!!)— the tortilla de patata and the hamon croquetas came out super fast! And so satisfying. Gustavo was so helpful and fun, he truly made our experience amazing! I sat in front of him drawing faces using chocolate sauce on plates for desserts. I laughed because the drawings were funny and creative. I asked if I can do one, and he said after I’m done eating! We both enjoyed the food so much, and had such a great time drinking and laughing. I was done with the food and ready to make a face!! Gustavo handed me a clean plate then the chocolate bottle. I originally tried to draw him, but didn’t account for the consistency of the chocolate and how hard it would be to control it (picture attached)— I did well my first try! And it made everyone laugh and it was cute :D — I thought he was gonna use it for some lucky table, but he gave us a delicious slice of passion fruit cheesecake!! If you love cheesecake, the flavor is delicious (I don’t like cheesecake but this is now my favorite!) Gustavo gave us a shot of some type of Madrid drink, which tasted like caramel. He said “This place here, id like Vegas!” Haha!  Anyway, come here if you wanna have a great time eating, drinking, hanging out with the bartenders or Gustavo :) You will have a great time!! We will definitely be back again!  Also accepts lots of different credit cards and is English friendly :D

title_review: Upper level tapas and awesome sangria
review_preview: I came here twice, both with my girlfriend and my family. The restaurant is located in a side street of a beatiful Madrid area, easily reachable with metro (2min from Anton Martin stop). Inside it's very small but comfortable. The menù has nothing super original,...
review_full: I came here twice, both with my girlfriend and my family. The restaurant is located in a side street of a beatiful Madrid area, easily reachable with metro (2min from Anton Martin stop). Inside it's very small but comfortable. The menù has nothing super original, represented by typical spanish tapas, but everything is very well prepared. I tried patatas bravas, polpo alla romana, empanadas and many other more. Each of them were absolutely satisfying. In addition to normal tapas the restaurant offers 3/4 main dishes (which change at the discrection of the chef and the period, I suppose) that are the real plus of this place. In the end I have to say that this is my n°1 place for sangria, absolutely delicious. Fair prices, you can easily eat and drink with 15/20€ each.

title_review: LOVELY SPOT IN THE HEART OF MADRID
review_preview: La Tabierna El Sur is a genuine place in Lavapiès neighborhood where you can find a nice mix of real castizos and some foreign tourists.Staff welcome you warmly and is always ready to fulfill your needs.Menu list is not wide but every meal...
review_full: La Tabierna El Sur is a genuine place in Lavapiès neighborhood where you can find a nice mix of real castizos and some foreign tourists. Staff welcome you warmly and is always ready to fulfill your needs. Menu list is not wide but every meal is well prepared and good quality; we tried a Cuban recipe, Ropa vieja, which is delicious, Mousaka that tasted very good and a sort of delicious gazpacho called Salmorejo. I suggest you to ask the customers who are keen on giving you good advices. Prices are very reasonable. The only downs could be the fact that the place is not huge and you might sometimes experience few minutes of waiting and that a guy of the crew, Alejandro, is an Inter FC supporter….please!!! :-)

The sangria was the best I had after several days in Barcelona and Madrid. It was made in house and full of fresh berries and other fruits. Other tried salads, a quiche, and the moussaka and all agreed their food was exceptional. It's worth the wander to find!

Would highly recommend this restaurant for the friendly service and reasonably priced excellent food.

title_review: Simply fabulous - not to be missed!
review_preview: We had dinner here this past evening and it was simply fabulous. Probably the best meal thus far on our trip through Spain. The waitress who waited on us was very helpful, both in terms of suggesting how much to order and in helping with...
review_full: We had dinner here this past evening and it was simply fabulous. Probably the best meal thus far on our trip through Spain. The waitress who waited on us was very helpful, both in terms of suggesting how much to order and in helping with the gluten-free needs of a member of our party. Even after ordering, one of the chefs came out to make sure we had what we needed on the gluten free front. Then the food came out and it was all delicious. We had a curry chicken dish, a shredded flank steak, a spicey potato tapas, scrambled eggs and asparagus, a beef filet dish, and a pork dish. It was fortunate that they provided enough good bread to soak up the sauces with, because we didn't want to miss any of it. The restaurant is off the beaten path, but don't be deceived. This is a real gem, not to be missed! It was also a good value. With four people in our party, we did not even exceed 50 euros for our bill, including a bottle of wine.

title_review: Lovely service and a great show
review_preview: This all felt so very Spanish. i made a reservation for myself alone and upon arrival they knew who I was and gave me a good seat in the house. I felt very welcome which is nice when you travel alone.You can choose from...
review_full: This all felt so very Spanish. i made a reservation for myself alone and upon arrival they knew who I was and gave me a good seat in the house. I felt very welcome which is nice when you travel alone. You can choose from different dishes on the menu depending on how many "hats" you have to spend. The food was ok, don' t expect to much but i still would go again because of the vibe. Off but especially on stage the flamenco musicians and dancers looked like they had a great time and that made it a lot of fun to watch and listen to. And it s a talented lot too! They would serve the courses in between the breaks in the show so that you and the dancers& musicians would not be disturbed. I would recommend this Taberna to anyone who is looking to visit one with a good show and a welcoming atmosphere.

A man and a woman dancers and two singers and a guitar player. The dancers where full of passion and were exceptional. As well as the others. But you are coming for the dancing right! They even had one small portion where they had women and children come on stage as one of the dancers taught some moves. It was super cute an fun! The crowed loved it! Small and intimate setting. We opted to order two extra drinks and paella. The bill came to 82€ for two people, which is less than opting for the 60€ meal per person. Sangria and most drinks are 5€. I highly recommend coming here!!! Absolutely loved!

review_preview: If you’ve never seen a flamenco show this is one of the easiest and most central ways to do it. The place dates back to 1961 and is situated in the heart of the tourist district below Plaza Mayor at Cava Baja and throws three...
review_full: If you’ve never seen a flamenco show this is one of the easiest and most central ways to do it. The place dates back to 1961 and is situated in the heart of the tourist district below Plaza Mayor at Cava Baja and throws three shows every night; 7, 9 and 11 pm and is often fully booked so be there in time. For 30€ (including a drink) you get the quick version of flamenco by really skilled artists. If you aren’t shy you can get on stage yourself and try some moves and steps. It’s a true tourist attraction but as said if you haven’t experienced flamenco this is one of the best ways to do it and well worth the entrance.

review_preview: We visited the restaurant following a recommendation by our hotel and are so glad we did! The restaurant appears small upon arrival with only 3/4 tables on the ground floor but has a fantastic, atmospheric seating area in the old bare red brick cellar downstairs...
review_full: We visited the restaurant following a recommendation by our hotel and are so glad we did! The restaurant appears small upon arrival with only 3/4 tables on the ground floor but has a fantastic, atmospheric seating area in the old bare red brick cellar downstairs (definitely ask to be seated down there!). We were given chicken soup on arrival while we waited and then delicious chunky bread with award winning olive oil once we were seated downstairs - off to a good start! The friendly waiter recommended a dry white wine - the third best white wine in the world (and only 22 euros!!) and we enjoyed it with two tapas platters with 4/5 different meats/cheeses/traditional Spanish dishes on each plate. The service was excellent and there was no pressure to rush. We spent 60 euros on a meal for two that felt so much more special and was more delicious than we had expected. A great find.

review_full: I booked this restaurant before our trip to Madrid at Easter based on TripAdvisor reviews and the proximity to where we were staying. It turned out to be a great choice. We were guided through the menu by a friendly, helpful and highly entertaining waiter who also recommended a delicious and very reasonably priced Rioja. The food was very good- perhaps a bit heavily weighted towards meat selections but I think that is the norm for Madrid. The ambiance of the restaurant was lively and friendly/ we were downstairs in what seemed to be a cave. The restaurant was packed at 9pm and reservations are essential. The meal was a bit pricey but comparable to the uk and great for a treat or special occasion.

review_preview: We found this restaurant on TripAdvisor after we couldn't get a table at a restaurant recommended by a friend. Our hotel phoned and booked us a table on the "terrace" which is really just a space outside a restaurant. It was ok for us as...
review_full: We found this restaurant on TripAdvisor after we couldn't get a table at a restaurant recommended by a friend. Our hotel phoned and booked us a table on the "terrace" which is really just a space outside a restaurant. It was ok for us as the evening was warm. The meal was amazing, the staff very helpful and the price was reasonable. I had grilled squid which was really tender and tasty and my husband had hake that was beautifully cooked and served with the best grilled courgettes and peppers we ever had! For dessert we shared a chocolate mousse and pistachio ice cream that was very, very good. A wonderful meal and we'll definitely go back next time we stay in Madrid.

review_preview: I booked a reservation for this restaurant following the great reviews I found on TripAdvisor, and I was not disappointed. Although we were a half an hour late, they saved the table for us, and the owner was kind enough to thank me for apologizing...
review_full: I booked a reservation for this restaurant following the great reviews I found on TripAdvisor, and I was not disappointed.  Although we were a half an hour late, they saved the table for us, and the owner was kind enough to thank me for apologizing for being late. The waiter (Julious?) was so welcoming and professional, and met our every need.  We asked for, and received, a table at the lovely cave area. It was romantic and had a wonderful atmosphere. Since it is underground there is no cellular reception there, which is great in my opinion, since it gives you a chance to disconnect and just relax and enjoy the company :) We ordered a bottle of red wine, which was superb, and kept on ordering exactly what our waiter recommended.  Anong other dishes, we had the t-bone steak and the pork, both done to perfection.  It was my husband's 40th b-day, so the desert came with a candle, a happy b-day made of strawberry syrup on the plate, and a song from our waiter. We spent over 3 hours at the table, and just could not get enough of this place. Do yourselves a favor- if ever in Madrid, visit this place!!

review_preview: Although Spaniards typically eat a late dinner (9pm and later) we came anyways because of the reviews! We only had tapas because we could not stay up that late enough (the kitchen opens at 8) but they were wonderful! Our server, Enrique, was so helpful...
review_full: Although Spaniards typically eat a late dinner (9pm and later) we came anyways because of the reviews! We only had tapas because we could not stay up that late enough (the kitchen opens at 8) but they were wonderful! Our server, Enrique, was so helpful and patient and the tapas were delicious! It was fun to try some traditional Spanish dishes! I would definitely suggest coming here at dinner. It is a fun location!
